revised_title: Systematics of Fullerenes and Related Carbon Clusters
tldr: This article explores the systematics of fullerenes and related carbon clusters, focusing on isomer generation, electronic structure, and geometric shapes. The author presents the ring-spiral algorithm and magic number rules to predict and count possible isomers and their properties. The article also discusses the stability and selection rules for interconversion of fullerenes and related structures, such as doped fullerenes, metallocarbohedrenes, and decorated-fullerene models for water clusters.
